Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Permit to Dig must be in place before any ground breaking activity commences, incl. trenching, driving waratahs or survey pegs, and topsoil strip. Permit to Dig will be based on BBO existing Services Drawings, Before U Dig Plans , potholing by the project, CAT & Genny survey, and visual inspections. All known services must be clearly marked on site and briefed to the workforce .

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspection of pipes prior to backfilling to ensure correct installation and that the joints are sealed. No damages caused to the pipeline.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For open trenching, detector tape shall be placed approximately 200mm below final ground level and metallic ‘detector’ tape coloured blue, stipulating ‘Danger – Water Main Below’ (or similar) shall be laid.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All Water Mains shall be laid in a straight line or following street layout. The deviation from approved design alignment permitted either in plan or elevation shall be: Open Cut – ± 50mm on straight and 100mm in curves All pipes, fitting and thrust blocks to be as built prior to backfilling
Standard / Specification - Vertical tolerance +/- 50mm Horizontal Between Structures +/- 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM Direct Transmission with a probe depth of 300mm Testing to be completed on 500mm lifts of backfill - 95% of MDD at OMC.
Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report
Frequency - Every 20m along trench 1 test every 5m² at driveways and footpaths

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - At least one working day advance notice shall be given to council for pressure testing of pipelines. All pipelines shall be pressure tested and backfilled after anchor blocks, specials and fittings are completed, but with joints and connections visible. The final tests are to be witnessed by Council prior to the pipe being connected to the ‘live’ network. No further connections will be permitted after this stage. Refer to NZS 4404 Appendix C3 for the requirements or if this not available, the pipe manufacturer’s procedure.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Appendix D of NZS 4404 – Water Supply Disinfection Specification shall apply Discharge of Testing or Chlorinated Water from pipelines may require a resource consent from the regional council

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - In commissioning new pipelines, Council shall be given 24 hours’ notice as to when sampling for bacteriological tests is to be carried out. Water in the pipeline shall be sampled between 12 hours and 48 hours after postchlorination flushing and the samples tested for the presence of E.coli, Coliforms and Heterotrophic Plate Count by a Ministry of Health Approved laboratory with IANZ accreditation for this type of test. The number of samples shall be at least one for projects involving less than 100m of pipe, two for projects up to 200m length, etc. “A satisfactory result is s <1 MPN/100ml for E.coli and Total Coliforms and less than 20 CFU/ml for Heterotrophic Plate Counts.” If E.coli is detected the pipeline shall be swabbed, flushed, disinfected, flushed again and then the bacteriological tests repeated. The process shall be repeated until such time a clear test is recorded. Note: There are high risks of test failure due to sample contamination so it is recommended that the testing laboratory is also involved in collecting the sample.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Invert Levels The permissible deviation from the designated level of the invert at each manhole or structure shall be ± 50mm, provided that the fall between successive manholes or structures shall be at least 90% of that specified. Horizontal Alignment The permissible deviation of the horizontal alignment between manholes or structures shall be ± 100mm. Gradient For straight gradients, the permissible deviation from the specified gradient shall be ± 50mm from a straight line drawn between the inverts of successive manholes, provided that no point in the pipeline is lower than any downstream point.
Standard / Specification - Vertical tolerance +/- 50mm Horizontal Between Structures +/- 100mm

Verifying Document - IANZ Lab Test Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The material shall comprise imported screened quarry blasting's and/or crushed basalt, greywacke or other angular hard rock which shall conform to Density, Crushing Resistance , Weathering Classification, Abrasion Resistance, Calcite intrusions, Grading, Shape. No rock riprap or boulders shall be placed until the Contractor has provided test results to prove compliance with the requirements and obtained approval of the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where soil riprap is specified on the Drawings, approved riprap rock shall be pre-mixed with topsoil from on site at a ratio of 70% riprap to 30% soil by volume.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where void-filled riprap is specified on the Drawings, the riprap rock shall be premixed with well graded granular material with a maximum particle size of 40mm (GAP 40) at a ratio of 70% riprap to 30% GAP 40 by volume.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Boulders must be approved by the Engineer, prior to placement Grout used for grouted boulder structures shall meet the requirements of NZS 3109
Verifying Document - Site Records Data Sheet
